app.routes package

Submodules

app.routes.auth_routes module

auth_routes.py

API routes for authentication and JWT management.

Provides endpoints for: - User registration - Login and token issuance - Refreshing access tokens - Retrieving current authenticated user - Logging out

app.routes.auth_routes.login_route(response: ~starlette.responses.Response, mail: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Log in a user and issue access token.

Authenticates the user by email and password, sets JWT cookies, and returns access token data.

Parameters: - mail: User email (form data) - password: User password (form data) - response: FastAPI Response object to set cookies - db: Database session

Returns: - TokenResponse object with access_token and token_type

app.routes.auth_routes.logout_route(response: Response)[source]

Logout the current user.

Deletes access and refresh token cookies.

Parameters: - response: FastAPI Response object to delete cookies

Returns: - JSON message confirming successful logout

app.routes.auth_routes.read_me(user: ~app.database.models.user.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve currently authenticated user.

Uses the access token from cookies to identify the user.

Parameters: - user: Currently authenticated User object (injected via dependency)

Returns: - Dictionary containing user_id, login, and email

app.routes.auth_routes.refresh_token_route(response: Response, refresh_token: str = Cookie(None))[source]

Refresh the access token using the refresh token.

Validates the refresh token, issues a new access token, and sets it in the cookies.

Parameters: - refresh_token: Refresh token from cookies - response: FastAPI Response object to set new access token

Returns: - JSON message indicating the token has been refreshed

app.routes.auth_routes.register_user_route(request: ~app.database.models.auth.UserRegister, response: ~starlette.responses.Response, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Register a new user.

Creates a new user in the database, hashes the password, issues access and refresh tokens, and sets cookies.

Parameters: - request: UserRegister object with login, email, password - response: FastAPI Response object to set cookies - db: Database session

Returns: - Newly created User object

app.routes.comment_routes module

comment_routes.py

API routes for commenting functionality.

Provides endpoints to: - Add a new comment to an event - Retrieve paginated comments for an event

app.routes.comment_routes.add_comment(event_id: int, comment_data: ~app.database.models.comment.CommentCreate, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Add a new comment to a specific event.

Creates a new comment in the database associated with the given event and the currently authenticated user. Logs the creation.

Parameters: - event_id: ID of the event to which the comment is added - comment_data: CommentCreate object containing comment content - db: Database session - user: Authenticated user creating the comment

Returns: - CommentRead object representing the newly created comment

app.routes.comment_routes.read_comments(event_id: int, limit: int = Query(20), offset: int = Query(0), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve paginated comments for a specific event.

Fetches a list of comments for the given event, ordered by creation time descending, and supports pagination via limit and offset. Logs the retrieval.

Parameters: - event_id: ID of the event whose comments are retrieved - limit: Maximum number of comments to return (default 20) - offset: Number of comments to skip (default 0) - db: Database session

Returns: - List of CommentRead objects for the event

app.routes.event_routes module

event_routes.py

API routes for Event CRUD operations.

Provides endpoints to: - Create a new event - Retrieve all events or a single event by ID - Update an existing event - Delete an event

app.routes.event_routes.add_event(event_data: ~app.database.models.event.EventCreate, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Create a new event.

Adds a new event to the database with the currently authenticated user set as the owner. Logs the creation.

app.routes.event_routes.edit_event(event_id: int, event_data: ~app.database.models.event.EventUpdate, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Update an existing event.

Allows the owner of the event to update its details. Raises 403 if the user is not the owner, 404 if the event does not exist.

app.routes.event_routes.read_event(event_id: int, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve a single event by its ID.

Fetches the event details from the database. Raises 404 if not found.

app.routes.event_routes.read_events(db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve all events.

Fetches a list of all events from the database and logs the retrieval.

app.routes.event_routes.remove_event(event_id: int, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Delete an existing event.

Allows the owner of the event to delete it. Raises 403 if the user is not the owner, 404 if the event does not exist.

app.routes.invites_routes module

invite_routes.py

Event Invitation (reusable, account-only) API endpoints.

Provides endpoints for creating and using reusable event invitations that require users to have an account. Multiple users can use the same invitation.

class app.routes.invites_routes.CreateInviteRequest(*, event_id: int)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

event_id: int
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

app.routes.invites_routes.accept_invitation(token: str, user: ~app.database.models.user.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Accept an event invitation with an authenticated account.

Adds the authenticated user to the event. The invitation remains valid for other users to use. Logs the acceptance.

app.routes.invites_routes.create_invite(request: ~app.routes.invites_routes.CreateInviteRequest, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user: ~app.database.models.user.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Create a reusable event invitation link.

Generates an invitation link for the specified event. Multiple users can use the invitation, but they must have an account.

app.routes.invites_routes.open_invite(token: str, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Resolve an event invitation token and return event details.

This endpoint is public and doesn’t require authentication. Returns basic event information so users can see what they are invited to.

app.routes.participations_routes module

participation_routes.py

API routes for participation survey functionality.

This module provides endpoints for: - Setting a user’s participation status for an event - Retrieving participation statistics for an event - Listing events where the user is participating or is the owner

app.routes.participations_routes.participate_in_event(event_id: int, participation: ~app.database.models.participations.ParticipationCreate, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Set participation status for a user in an event.

Updates or creates the participation record for the authenticated user for the specified event.

Parameters: - event_id: ID of the event - participation: ParticipationCreate object with status (going/maybe/not_going) - db: Database session - user: Currently authenticated user

Returns: - EventParticipation object reflecting the user’s participation status

app.routes.participations_routes.read_event_participation_stats(event_id: int, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve participation statistics for a specific event.

Counts how many users are going, maybe, or not going to the event.

Parameters: - event_id: ID of the event - db: Database session

Returns: - Dictionary with participation counts, e.g. {“going”: int, “maybe”: int, “not_going”: int}

app.routes.participations_routes.read_my_active_events(db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Get a list of events the current user is participating in or owns.

Includes events where the user has a participation record or is the event owner.

Parameters: - db: Database session - user: Currently authenticated user

Returns: - List of events with participation status, e.g.:

[{“id”: int, “name”: str, “location”: str, “time”: str,

“owner_id”: int, “participation_status”: str | None}, …]

app.routes.passes_routes module

passes_routes.py

Event Pass (magic link) API endpoints.

Provides endpoints for creating and consuming event-specific pass links that allow passwordless access for guest users and controlled linking to registered user accounts.

class app.routes.passes_routes.CreatePassRequest(*, display_name: str)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

display_name: str
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

app.routes.passes_routes.accept_as_guest(token: str, response: ~starlette.responses.Response, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Accept an event pass as a guest user.

Creates a new guest user, binds the pass to that user, and logs the user in. If the pass is already bound, the existing user is logged in instead.

app.routes.passes_routes.accept_with_existing_login(token: str, response: ~starlette.responses.Response, user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Bind an event pass to an authenticated user.

Links the event pass to the currently authenticated user, enabling controlled access.

app.routes.passes_routes.create_pass(event_id: int, request: ~app.routes.passes_routes.CreatePassRequest = Body(PydanticUndefined), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Create a personal event pass.

Generates an event pass link for the specified event. The pass is initially unbound and can later be claimed by a guest or linked to an existing user account.

app.routes.passes_routes.open_pass(token: str, response: ~starlette.responses.Response, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Resolve an event pass token.

Determines the state of the pass and the required next action. - If the pass is bound to a guest user, the user is automatically logged in. - If bound to a registered user, explicit login is required. - If unbound, returns display name and event info.

app.routes.user_routes module

users_routes.py

API endpoints for User CRUD operations.

Provides routes to: - List all users - Retrieve a single user - Change user password - Delete user account

app.routes.user_routes.read_user(user_id: int, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve a single user by ID.

Parameters:

  • user_id – ID of the user to retrieve.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

UserResponse object for the specified user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the user does not exist.

app.routes.user_routes.read_users(db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Retrieve all users.

Fetches a list of all users in the database.

app.routes.user_routes.remove_user(user_id: int, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Delete a user account.

Only the currently authenticated user can delete their own account.

Parameters:

  • user_id – ID of the user to delete.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • current_user – Currently authenticated user.

Returns:

JSON object indicating success: {“ok”: True}.

Raises:

  • HTTPException 403 – If a user attempts to delete another user’s account.

  • HTTPException 404 – If the user does not exist.

app.routes.user_routes.update_password(user_id: int, data: ~app.database.models.user.PasswordChange, db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user=Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]

Change the password for a user.

Only the currently authenticated user can change their own password.

Parameters:

  • user_id – ID of the user whose password is to be changed.

  • data – PasswordChange object containing current and new password.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • current_user – Currently authenticated user.

Returns:

JSON object indicating success: {“ok”: True}.

Raises:

  • HTTPException 403 – If the user attempts to change another user’s password.

  • HTTPException 400 – If the password change fails (current password incorrect or new passwords mismatch).
